text: Lale Akarun (born 10 March 1962) is a Turkish electrical engineer and computer scientist researching sign language and gesture recognition, human–computer interaction, and biometrics. She is a professor in the computer engineering department and vice rector at Boğaziçi University. == Early life and education == Lale Akarun was born on 10 March 1962 in Ankara. She completed a B.S. (1984) and M.S. (1986) in electrical engineering at Boğaziçi University. She earned a Ph.D. in electrical engineering with a minor in computer science from the Polytechnic University of NYU in 1992. Her dissertation was titled Decimated Rank Order Filtering. Akarun's doctoral advisor was . She researched digital image processing and computer vision during her doctoral studies. == Career and research == Akarun joined the faculty at Boğaziçi University in 1992 as an assistant professor. She was promoted to full professor in the computer engineering department in 2002. She served as departmental chair from 2010 to 2012. In 2012, she became vice rector of the university.
